result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Bodily Harm or Threat to Employee of Health Care Facility or Family

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice R Knutson

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:14 PM Defendant Maurice R Knutson in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Maurice R Knutson.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
21CF232, 21FO481, 21TR2961, 22CF193

21CF232 - ARGN
Atty Kelm - rcvd Information. Understands charges and penalties. Enters NG plea.

22CF193 - PTC
Atty Kelm - asks for prelim. 
Court - sets prelim on 12/5/22 at 11:00 AM. 21CF232, 21FO481, 21TR2961 to tagalong as status.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: No contact with Red Cedar Hospital or Mayo Clinic Menomonie except for emergency purposes.  No possession of firearms.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No contact with Red Cedar Hospital or Mayo Clinic Menomonie except for emergency purposes.  No possession of firearms.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maurice R Knutson appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared by video for Maurice R Knutson. B. Bahr - Clerk 
21CF232, 22CF193

22CF193 - INIT
Atty Kelm - assumes he has. Not been appointed to this case. Does not rep on this case.
Atty Tomtschik - does qualify for PD now that he has 2 cases pending. 
DE - rcvd complaint. 
State - requesting $2,500 cash bond. No contact with Red Cedar Hospital or Mayo Menomonie except for emergency purposes. No possession of firearms. 
Atty Tomtschik - argues. DE has small amount of cash - $300.
Court - orders $250.00. No contact with Red Cedar Hospital or Mayo Clinic Menomonie except for emergency purposes. No possession of firearms.
Atty Tomtschik - waive timelimits on prelim.
Court - sets return date of 9/12/22 at 8:45 AM.
Atty Kelm - that date does not work. 
Court - Sept 13 at 2 pm.

21CF232 - Bond modification hrg
State - requesting bond be modified from $1,000 sign bond to a $1,000 cash bond. Not to possess or consume alcohol. 
Atty Kelm - argues. Has not spoken to client about bond request yet. Has not violated past bond or missed any court. Has prelim on 6/17/22.
Court - orders bond be modified from $1,000 sign bond to $100 cash bond. Not to possess or consume alcohol.
Agreement to receive text message reminders for upcoming court dates.
